name: Game Dev Manager
description: The ultimate system to organise and streamline your game development process — all within Notion.Effortlessly plan, design, and document game projects.Manage game ideas, track development, and keep your workflow efficient — all within your Notion-powered workspace.What’s IncludedMain Game Board: Your central hub for all game projects, neatly categorised by their status. Easily navigate through active, paused, and completed games.Blueprint Page: Dive into the heart of your game with the Blueprint
features: Main Game Board: Your central hub for all game projects, neatly categorised by their status. Easily navigate through active, paused, and completed games.; Blueprint Page: Dive into the heart of your game with the Blueprint Page. Craft stories, define characteristics, visualise the look and feel, and outline intricate relationships between characters.; Development Log: Linked to each game, the Development Log documents your journey from inspiration to breakthroughs, perfect for reflection or sharing updates.; Sub-Tasks for Game Development: Break down your game into manageable sub-tasks, ensuring no detail is overlooked and keeping you on track.; Set Up Game Pages: Create detailed game project pages, defining genres, storylines, and character details.; Develop Blueprints: Use the blueprint page to map out your game’s design, visual style, and character dynamics.; Track Development Progress: Use the development log to capture key milestones and document your progress.; Break Down Tasks: Divide game creation into specific sub-tasks to maintain organisation and track completion rates.; Review and Reflect: Use the main game board to get an overview of active and completed games, optimising your workflow.; To streamline the planning and documentation of game development projects.
